name: Create User Personas from Research
prompt: I conducted 10 user interviews for our fitness app. Key findings: 7 users are busy professionals (30-45) who want quick workouts, 3 are fitness enthusiasts (25-35) who track detailed metrics. All mentioned struggling with motivation. Create 2 personas based on this.
expectations: Creates 2 distinct personas with names and roles
Defines clear goals for each persona
Bases personas on actual research data mentioned
Makes personas feel realistic and actionable

name: Design User Flow for Checkout
prompt: I need a user flow for an e-commerce checkout process. Users can checkout as guest or create account, need to add shipping address and payment, and should see order confirmation. Include error states.
expectations: Uses proper flow diagram notation (rectangles, diamonds, ovals)
Shows decision points (guest vs. login, payment method)
Includes happy path from cart to confirmation
Maps error scenarios (invalid card, out of stock)
Includes all mentioned steps (shipping, payment, confirmation)

name: Create Information Architecture for Blog
prompt: I'm building a tech blog with 200+ articles across categories: Web Dev, Mobile, DevOps, Design, AI/ML. Also have About, Contact, Newsletter signup. Design the information architecture and navigation.
expectations: Defines primary navigation (likely: Articles, Categories, About, Contact)

name: Wireframe Mobile App Dashboard
prompt: Create a low-fidelity wireframe for a fitness app dashboard. Users need to see: today's activity summary, quick start workout button, upcoming scheduled workouts, and progress chart. Mobile-first design.
expectations: Prioritizes most important info at top (activity summary)
Uses placeholders instead of real content

name: Design System Color Palette
prompt: Create a color palette for a financial services app. Brand color is blue (#1E40AF). Need primary, secondary, neutral, and semantic colors. Ensure accessibility compliance.
expectations: Uses provided blue as primary color
Creates shades and tints of primary
Sets semantic colors (success, error, warning, info)
Mentions contrast ratios and WCAG compliance
Provides hex codes for all colors

name: Typography System Design
prompt: Design a typography system for a content-heavy website. Need hierarchy from headings to body text. Consider readability and web performance.
expectations: Considers web fonts vs system fonts for performance

name: Plan Usability Test for New Feature
prompt: We built a new calendar scheduling feature and want to test it with users. Help me plan a usability test session including recruitment, tasks, and what to measure.
expectations: Defines test goals and what to learn
Avoids using UI labels in task descriptions
Defines success metrics (completion rate, time on task)

name: Accessibility Audit Findings
prompt: Review this design: white text on light blue background (#E3F2FD), buttons are 32x32px, no focus indicators, form inputs without labels, images without alt text. What accessibility issues exist?
expectations: Identifies contrast issue (white on light blue fails WCAG)
Flags small touch target size (should be 44x44pt minimum)
Notes missing focus indicators for keyboard navigation
Points out form inputs need visible labels
Mentions missing alt text for images
Explains impact on users with disabilities
Provides specific fixes for each issue

name: Create Journey Map for Online Shopping
prompt: Map the user journey for someone shopping for a laptop online, from initial research through post-purchase. Include emotional states and pain points.
expectations: Defines journey phases (awareness, research, comparison, purchase, delivery, use)
Lists user actions in each phase
Maps touchpoints (search, review sites, checkout, email, delivery)
Shows emotional curve with highs and lows
Identifies pain points (comparison overwhelm, slow shipping anxiety)
Highlights moments of truth or critical decision points
Covers entire journey from research to post-purchase

name: Design System Component Documentation
prompt: Create documentation for a Button component with Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary variants. Include specs for developers.
expectations: Describes component purpose and when to use
Documents all states (default, hover, active, focus, disabled)
Specifies dimensions and touch target size
Lists colors for each variant and state
Provides code examples or design tokens

name: Critique Dashboard Design
prompt: I designed a dashboard with 8 different chart types, 12 colors, 4 font families, and every space filled with data. Provide constructive design critique.
expectations: Identifies visual clutter and cognitive overload
Suggests reducing number of chart types
Suggests progressive disclosure for complex data

name: Design Responsive Navigation
prompt: Design navigation for a website with 8 main sections. Should work on desktop (1440px), tablet (768px), and mobile (375px). Consider accessibility.
expectations: Shows desktop horizontal navigation with all items visible
Recommends collapsing to hamburger menu on mobile
Suggests tablet treatment (partial collapse or dropdown)
Ensures touch targets are 44x44pt minimum on mobile
Mentions skip to main content link
Addresses ARIA labels for mobile menu

name: Design Error State Messaging
prompt: Users are trying to upload profile photos but getting errors. Design error messages for: file too large (limit 5MB), wrong file type (need JPG/PNG), and upload failed (network error).
expectations: Creates clear, specific error messages for each scenario
Uses plain language, avoids technical jargon
Provides actionable solution for each error
Suggests inline validation to prevent errors
Shows file size limit before upload
Offers retry option for network errors

name: Design Onboarding Flow
prompt: Create an onboarding flow for a task management app. Users need to create account, set preferences, create first project, and invite team member. Keep it under 5 steps.
expectations: Starts with value proposition or benefit
Provides option to skip entire onboarding

name: Design Data Table with Filters
prompt: Design a data table showing 500+ user records with columns: name, email, role, status, joined date. Users need to sort, filter, and search. Consider mobile view.
expectations: Shows clear column headers with sort indicators
Shows selected filters with ability to clear
Addresses mobile view (card layout or simplified table)
Shows empty state when no results
